text: peripheral manufacturers see smartphones
as a blank canvas on which to paint
their own vision of mobile phone
perfection mainly by creating devices
which plug into or bolt onto them in
order to improve a particular feature a
dedicated handheld games machine like
Nintendo's 3ds or the PlayStation Vita
is always going to trump a smartphone as
far as playing games are concerned
mainly because of buttons and pads and
analog sticks these are simply more
responsive and accurate and matching
your fingers joylessly against a phone
screen which is where the PowerShell
comes in plug an iOS device like an
iPhone 5 or new ipod touch with a
lightning port on it into the shell that
adds a d-pad buttons and shoulder
bumpers the shell also acts as an
additional battery extending the phone's
power reserves however not every iphone
game will work with the shell at the
moment about 45 games are compatible but
that list is set to grow when you do
find a compatible game though it does a
pretty good job of transforming a
telephone into a handheld games machine
the controls are responsive and it feels
a lot less like you're playing a game on
a phone smartphones can of course store
and play music and there are lots and
lots of docks and speakers which phones
plug into in order to listen to your
stored up tunage HTC one phone has these
speakers mounted on the front combine
those with this 3d printed contraption
called a grammar horn to you get the
fifty percent volume increase there
aren't any electronics inside this thing
at all basically like an old-fashioned
gramophone speaker so old-school
technology then that cutting-edge 3d
printed twist
however if the 3d printed versions
aren't cutting it for you they are
available in milled steel now at this
time of year it's not uncommon for
people to overindulge but while eating
too much simply leads to an expanded
waistline drinking too much alcohol can
have more immediately dangerous effects
especially for anybody considering
getting behind the wheel of a car well
android an iOS smartphone users who are
unsure if they've had one too many can
plug this device called an alco hoot
into their phone download the app that
goes with it plug the box into the phone
via the headphone jack and blow into
here and in a few seconds the Box
analyzes the user's breath to measure
their blood alcohol level and provides
an on-screen readout I haven't had a
drop all day it can also keep a track of
a user's blood alcohol over the course
of a night a monitor if it's going up or
down and if the alcohol level is too
high then its user will definitely need
to get a cab or make use of a sober
designated driver
